alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 10:50PM MDT until March 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Storm total accumulations of one to five feet with locally higher amounts possible on west facing slopes. Winds gusting as high as 85 mph. The heavy snow will fall through late this evening and then decrease overnight. The snow will ramp up once again later Tuesday morning and continue through Wednesday night. Snow fall rates of 2 to 4 inches per hour are likely, especially Wednesday. The most intense winds will occur on Wednesday, and will occur along ridge-line and mountain passes. * WHERE...Upper Rio Grande Valley/Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Feet and Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft
